name: 'Yellow Mage' Two-Bladed Spell-sword Improved Disarmer (Cleric 15 / Bard 15 / RDD 10)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This is a ridiculously ambitious build I have concocted.

Firstly its a MAD build (Multi-attribute dependent). Str for AB. Dex for dual wielding feats. Cons needed for HP for melee. Wisdom for cleric spells. Int for skills and improved disarm. Charisma for divine damage.

None of my starting stats, incredibly, are more than 14. Normally that is a red flag for a build. I'm choosing to take RDD cheese to compensate for this. Lets see if I can make this work.

Secondly not only have I made a 'Yellow Mage' (well a cleric/bard, wasn't sure what colour it was gonna be, but it wasn't gonna be red), but made him a Two-bladed sword wielder with ITWF with improved disarm. 

The idea of Improved Disarm is to taking advantage of the large weapon size of the two-bladed sword and the extra attacks.

With Divine Favor / Divine Power / Other Cleric buffs / Bard song / Curse song / Taunt and Improved Disarm and Base AB 38 he should be able to hit enemies and remove their weapons.

Making combat a little easier for you. Maybe you could pilfer their weapons and run off too, once your tumble skill is high enough :)

With Divine Might Divine Favor and 28 base strength potentially cappable to 40 he should be able to do some damage. 

Anyway the big weakness is most buffs  are dispellable, but there is enough left over (Taunt / Divine Might / Bard Song / Curse Song / RDD goodness) to deal with whatever problems enemies might cause you.

But without a knockdown skill if this guy encounters a real mage he might have to run for the hills.

Maybe I should drop Blind Fight for knockdown?

Health I got up to about 370 odd and I'm loathe to lower HP any further he probably does need toughness.

I could have dropped taunt and cross-classed the set trap skill to be able to set deadly traps

Anyway wondering what you guys thought. Could be garbage, but it could be good too?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:
Oct 28, 2019
This is a ridiculously ambitious build I have concocted.
Anyway wondering what you guys thought. Could be garbage, but it could be good too?
This "yellow mage" is original in more ways than just the new name. The weapon choice and the synergy with Disarm is a great idea for a dual wielder. DM is almost over the top, but it works.
You blend 3 power classes here:
Cleric has the strongest buffing spells. RDD is the character builder's wet dream. Bard is the master of performance.'
Your build is feat starved and you keep taking pre-epic feats throughout the epic levls.
In a way you break many principles for power building, but the power of the 3 classes more than compensates for that, and it ends up being really powerful after all.
The build has something in common with both Mith's "Blood and Faith" and my own "Spirit and Steel".
But to be able to have both RDD10 and a strong Bard song, you have to do with 15 Cleric levels.
You will find many self buffing power builds with 15 Cleric levels. Most AB and AC buffs will give a +5 bonus and DP will last long enough for most battles. You have to do without the level 9 spells though, and you must be prepared to be dispelled.
Taking 3 classes means you have to make a choice between them when deciding what to develop first.
IMO Cleric comes first. And I would choose a Cleric 12/ Bard4/ RDD4 pre epic split. With Bard at lvl 1, 7, 12 and 17 and RDD at level 16 and 18 - 20.
In epic I would take Cleric at 21, 23 and 24 and RDD at 25, 26 and 28 - 31. So Bard would come last at 22, 27, and 32 - 40
As for feats, I would rather see Extend Spell than Toughness. And I would weight Empower and AS against PA and DM. I would also love to see  IKD in there as well. But that would probably mean no Disarm feats, and that is asking too much here.
The choice of a double weapon can feel a bit limiting when you need a shield for AC. But with the buffs available here you can easily pick up a Bastard sword and swing it successfully, only 1 AB below  what you have when you wield your Double sword.
You pick many great skills. I miss Spellcraft for this "mage". You will probably be able to land most attacks without the help from Taunt.
The target for UMD depends on what gear that is available. Bards only need 10 modified UMD to be able to use all scrolls without failure even on the most difficult settings.

All in all a fine build. Now test it and see if you want to post it in the 40s.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Mick for your very thoughtful post regarding a very 'out of the box' build

I thought it would be fun in a persistent world party situation, where there are super powerful mages/cleric, fighter RDDs in a party, everyone expects that stuff, and...

you rock up with a: 

Party member: "?what yellow mage two-bladed sword improved disarmer with divine damage? who are you?"

You: "Yup and optimised by the ECB"

Its sort of like when you rock up to a costume party with the most outrageous costume that fits the rules, you know a 'trend breaker'

I digress

I like the idea of advancing cleric levels earlier to get the buffs faster, even if they are undispellable.
I'll just have to get disarm and improved disarm later on in the build which I don't believe to be a major issue, there are so many feats this build needs to fit in.
I thought about Blind Fight vs Knockdown, and I believe this build needs Knockdown to deal with spell casters, if they have improved invisibility up, I simply will have to use UMD and Mord them unfortunately II is not breachable
I like the idea of extend spell but I do want to get the HP as close as I can to 400 for a dedicated melee'er who can get dispelled.
To incorporate extend spell and keep toughness I could drop the AB down to 37. Normally I am not keen on dropping the AB too much but I suspect this build can manage in a mid-magic environment with all the buffs available. I will consider this
I could drop Taunt down to about 20 (kind of a cross class maximum) and put some points in spellcraft to help identify spells being cast & get some saves against them which is a good idea
Thanks for your point on bastard swords and tower shields, I had forgot about that!

Thanks again Mick!
